text: Estimation priors affect treatment effects estimated Bayesian model fitting. compare default priors versus informative priors. Ancova model two arms used illustrate impact different priors power analysis results. compare uninformative sceptical priors. Let’s first define sample size analysis: Uninformative, locally flat prior treatment effect: \[d \sim \mathcal{N}(0,100)\] Analysis Informative Prior Informative, sceptical prior treatment effect: \[d \sim \mathcal{t_3}(0,1)\] Comparing results two analyses: evaluate alpha error rate (false positive rate) prior configurations, need run power analysis null hypothesis (effect size = 0) examine often incorrectly conclude success. tells us well Bayesian decision framework controls Type error. Luckily, rctbayespower package allows us reuse model design configurations, changing effect size zero. Comparing alpha error rates: Using sceptical prior reduces probability falsely concluding success true effect, thus controlling alpha error rate effectively uninformative priors.
